products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-slz-vsi
products.label: VSI on VPC landing zone
products.short_description: Provides workload VSI to be included with Secure infrastructure on VPC for regulated industries
products.long_description: Secure Workload VSIs on secure VPC for regulated industries is a preconfigured solution based on the IBM Cloud for Financial Services reference architecture. It creates secure and compliant VSIs on top of an existing Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) network.

features.description: Secure and protected virtual servers are automatically created and set up to handle the workload.
features.title: Creates virtual servers for workloads

flavors.label: QuickStart
flavors.name: quickstart
flavors.usage_template:
module "landing-zone" {
  source           = "https://cm.globalcatalog.cloud.ibm.com/api/v1-beta/offering/source//${{workingDirectory}}?archive=tgz&flavor=${{flavor}}&kind=terraform&name=${{name}}&version=${{version}}"
  ibmcloud_api_key = var.ibmcloud_api_key
  ssh_public_key   = var.ssh_public_key
  region           = "us-south"
  prefix           = "slz"
}

features.title: Separate VPC for management
Separate VPC for workloads
Virtual Server Instances for every subnet
Increases security with Key Management
Reduces failure events by using multizone regions
Collects and stores Internet Protocol (IP) traffic information with Activity Tracker and Flow Logs
Securely connects to multiple networks with a site-to-site virtual private network
Simplifies risk management and demonstrates regulatory compliance with Financial Services
Uses an edge VPC for secure access through the public internet
Uses Floating IP address for access through the public internet

diagrams.description:
The **QuickStart** flavor of Secure Landing Zone with VSIs requires at least 2 CPUs and 4 GB of memory.

Secure Landing Zone with virtual server instances is implemented with virtual servers. It utilizes two separate Virtual Private Clouds (VPC), a Management VPC and a Workload VPC, to manage the environment and the deployed workload. Each VPC is a multi-zoned, multi-subnet implementation that keeps your workloads secure.

Virtual Private Endpoints connect the VPCs to each other and to IBM Cloud services, including Key Protect, IAM, Container Registry, Object Storage, and any additional services. IBM Cloud services are configured for storage and key management.

IBM Cloud Flow Logs for VPC enable the collection, storage, and presentation of information about the Internet Protocol (IP) traffic that is going to and from network interfaces within your VPC. In addition, Activity Tracker logs events from enabled services. IBM Cloud Flow Logs for VPC and Activity Tracker are included in this configuration. Additional security services can be added such as Hyper Connect Crypto Service.

flavors.label: Standard
flavors.name: standard
flavors.usage_template:
module "landing-zone" {
  source           = "https://cm.globalcatalog.cloud.ibm.com/api/v1-beta/offering/source//${{workingDirectory}}?archive=tgz&flavor=${{flavor}}&kind=terraform&name=${{name}}&version=${{version}}"
  ibmcloud_api_key = var.ibmcloud_api_key
  ssh_public_key   = var.ssh_public_key
  region           = "us-south"
  prefix           = "slz"
}

outputs.description: A list of the names of the VPC
ID of the IBM Cloud Schematics workspace. Returns null if not ran in Schematics
A list of VSI with name, id, zone, and primary ipv4 address, VPC Name, and floating IP.
A list of the vsis names provisioned within the VPCs
The prefix that is associated with all resources
The string value of the ssh public key
The name of the transit gateway
A list of VSI with name, id, zone, and primary ipv4 address, VPC Name, and floating IP. This list only contains instances with a floating IP attached.

diagrams.description:
Secure Landing Zone with virtual server instances is implemented with virtual servers running in a single, defined Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) which is used to manage the environment. The VPC is a multi-zoned, multi-subnet implementation that keeps your VPC secure and highly available.  Virtual Private Endpoints connect the VPCs to each other and to IBM Cloud services, including Key Protect, IAM, Container Registry, Object Storage, and any additional services. IBM Cloud services are configured for storage and key management.  

IBM Cloud Flow Logs for VPC enable the collection, storage, and presentation of information about the Internet Protocol (IP) traffic that is going to and from network interfaces within your VPC. In addition, Activity Tracker logs events from enabled services. IBM Cloud Flow Logs for VPC and Activity Tracker are included in this configuration. Additional security services can be added such as Hyper Connect Crypto Service.

products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-slz-vpc
products.label: VPC landing zone
products.short_description: Provides a secure VPC infrastructure utilizing the IBM Cloud for Financial Services reference architecture.
products.long_description: Secure infrastructure on VPC for regulated industries is a preconfigured solution based on the IBM Cloud for Financial Services reference architecture. It creates a secure and compliant infrastructure to run your workloads with a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

features.description: Virtual Private Clouds are created for you with the necessary underlying network components.
features.title: Creates Virtual Private Clouds

features.description: Cloud Object Storage instance and buckets are created to support Flow Logs and Activity Tracker.
features.title: Supports Flow Logs and Activity tracking

flavors.label: Standard
flavors.name: standard
flavors.usage_template:
module "landing-zone-vpc" {
  source           = "https://cm.globalcatalog.cloud.ibm.com/api/v1-beta/offering/source//${{workingDirectory}}?archive=tgz&flavor=${{flavor}}&kind=terraform&name=${{name}}&version=${{version}}"
  ibmcloud_api_key = var.ibmcloud_api_key
  ssh_public_key   = var.ssh_public_key
  region           = "us-south"
  prefix           = "slz-vpc"
}

products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-slz-ocp
products.label: Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform on VPC landing zone
products.short_description: Provides workload Openshift Container Platform to be included with Secure infrastructure on VPC for regulated industries
products.long_description: OpenShift Container Platform on VPC for regulated industries is a preconfigured solution based on the IBM Cloud for Financial Services reference architecture. It creates secure and compliant RedHat(TM) OpenShift Container Platform (OCP) workload clusters on an existing Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) network.

features.description: Secure and protected Openshift Container Platform clusters are automatically created and set up to handle the workload.
features.title: Creates Openshift Container Platform clusters for workloads

flavors.label: Standard
flavors.name: standard
flavors.usage_template:
module "landing-zone" {
  source           = "https://cm.globalcatalog.cloud.ibm.com/api/v1-beta/offering/source//patterns/roks?archive=tgz&flavor=${{flavor}}&kind=terraform&name=${{name}}&version=${{version}}"
  ibmcloud_api_key = var.ibmcloud_api_key
  ssh_public_key   = var.ssh_public_key
  region           = "us-south"
  prefix           = "slz"
}

Virtual Private Endpoints connect the VPCs to each other and to IBM Cloud services, including Key Protect, IAM, Container Registry, Object Storage, and any additional services. IBM Cloud services are configured for storage and key management.  

IBM Cloud Flow Logs for VPC enable the collection, storage, and presentation of information about the Internet Protocol (IP) traffic that is going to and from network interfaces within your VPC.
